intro: Hecatactis papuana, commonly known as the Papuan star-flower, is a flowering plant native to the highland regions of Papua, Indonesia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and related plants. The plant is characterized by its star-shaped flowers, which are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in montane forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
